result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. McCormick

defendant.name: McCormick, Robert J.
defendant.address: N8399 Birch Hill Rd, Phillips, WI 54555

records.addlTxt:
10:37 AM Defendant Robert J. McCormick in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DE states he has not received complaint. DA provides complaint to DE. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Bond to continue. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Notice of right to attorney given to DE. If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J. McCormick
Current: N8399 Birch Hill Rd, Phillips, WI 54555   (Effective: 05-23-2022)
Prior: 174 Kimball St., Phillips, WI 54555
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: 10:45 Am DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE next court date is  05/31/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Defendant objects to the recommendation by the State. Court questions defendant in regards to ties to Prie County. DA Kelz makes statements in response to objection. Bond set $500 CB and 2,500 SB. So Ordered.
